skill.name: Vitest Testing Skill - Master Reference
skill.description: **AI-friendly comprehensive testing guidance for Vitest with practical patterns and behavior-driven development.**
skill.summary: **AI-friendly comprehensive testing guidance for Vitest with practical patterns and behavior-driven ...
skill.author: AdamManuel-dev

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no code execution capabilities. Contains only markdown guidance and example TypeScript test code demonstrating Vitest patterns. No network access, no file system access beyond own files, no external commands.

content.value_statement: Writing reliable unit tests is challenging without clear patterns. This skill provides AI-optimized Vitest guidance with F.I.R.S.T principles, AAA pattern structure, black box testing strategy, and comprehensive examples for mocks, async code, and error scenarios.
actual_capabilities: Apply F.I.R.S.T principles for quality tests (Fast, Isolated, Repeatable, Self-Checking, Timely)
Implement black box testing through public APIs
Create mocks, stubs, spies, and fakes with Vitest
Test async code with promises, async/await, and fake timers
Handle error scenarios and edge cases in tests
limitations: Does not execute tests or modify project files
Does not provide test coverage analysis
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines
Requires existing Vitest setup to apply guidance

prompt_templates.title: Basic Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Vitest unit test for [function/component name] following F.I.R.S.T principles and AAA pattern. Include happy path and error cases.

prompt_templates.title: Async Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Write tests for async function [name] that handles promises and potential errors. Use appropriate async testing patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Mocking
prompt_templates.prompt: Create comprehensive mocks for [dependency] in Vitest. Include stubbed return values and verification of interactions.

prompt_templates.title: Error Cases
prompt_templates.prompt: Write error handling tests for [function] covering validation errors, edge cases, and failure scenarios using Vitest matchers.

output_examples.input: Write a Vitest test for a UserService.register function that validates email and password, hashes passwords before storage, and sends welcome emails
output: Test creates user with valid data
Test handles database and email service failures

best_practices: Use mocks for all external dependencies to keep tests fast (<100ms) and isolated
Test only through public APIs (black box approach) to make tests refactoring-resistant
Structure every test with clear Arrange-Act-Assert sections and descriptive names
anti_patterns: Testing private methods directly breaks encapsulation and makes tests fragile
Making real database or network calls in tests creates slow, flaky, order-dependent tests
Skipping error scenario testing leaves critical failure modes uncovered

faq.question: How does this skill differ from official Vitest documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-optimized decision trees, patterns, and examples focused on test quality principles rather than API reference.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for Jest projects?
faq.answer: Most patterns apply to Jest. See the quick-reference/jest-to-vitest.md for syntax differences and migration guidance.

faq.question: Does this skill generate executable test files?
faq.answer: No, the skill provides guidance and examples. Users must implement tests in their own projects.

faq.question: What test coverage should I aim for?
faq.answer: Focus on behavior coverage through public APIs. Aim for meaningful coverage of business logic, not arbitrary percentage targets.

faq.question: How do I test React components?
faq.answer: See patterns/component-testing.md for React Testing Library integration patterns with Vitest.

faq.question: Can this skill help with integration tests?
faq.answer: Yes, see patterns/integration-testing.md for testing database connections, external APIs, and service interactions.
